intro: Climacoptera botschantzevii, commonly known as the mountain hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and large, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink and white. The plant has palmately lobed leaves and is adapted to cold, arid environments. It is often found in rocky soils and alpine meadows at elevations above 2,000 meters. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
